posts.title: Best fertilizer for wheat crop in Punjab?
posts.content: I'm planning to grow wheat this season in Amritsar district. What fertilizer combination would you recommend for optimal yield? My soil pH is around 7.2.
posts.author: FarmerRaj

answers.content: For wheat in Punjab with pH 7.2, I recommend NPK 20:10:10 at sowing, followed by urea top-dressing at tillering stage. Also consider adding DAP for phosphorus.
answers.author: AgroExpert

answers.content: I've been using organic compost mixed with vermicompost for my wheat fields. Results have been excellent with improved soil health.
answers.author: OrganicFarmer

posts.title: Dealing with aphid infestation in mustard crop
posts.content: My mustard crop is showing signs of aphid attack. The leaves are curling and there's honeydew on the plants. What's the best treatment approach?
posts.author: GreenThumb

answers.content: For aphids on mustard, spray neem oil solution (5ml per liter) early morning or evening. Also introduce ladybugs if possible - they're natural predators.
answers.author: IPMSpecialist

posts.title: Tip: Crop rotation benefits for soil health
posts.content: After 5 years of practicing legume-cereal rotation (chickpea-wheat), I've noticed 20% improvement in soil organic matter and reduced fertilizer needs. Highly recommend this practice!
posts.author: SustainableFarmer

posts.title: Weather impact on rice transplanting timing
posts.content: With changing monsoon patterns, when is the optimal time for rice transplanting in central Punjab? Should we wait for consistent rainfall or start with irrigation?
posts.author: RiceFarmer2024

answers.content: Based on meteorological data, mid-June to early July is still optimal. Don't wait too long for monsoon - start with irrigation if needed. Delayed transplanting reduces yield significantly.
answers.author: WeatherExpert
